required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exercise Intensity, Metabolic Rate and Insulin Sensitivity

oversight_info.authority: United States: National Institute of Health

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary goal is to test the hypothesis high interval exercise increases energy expenditure and Insulin sensitivity more than 2 days of rest or moderate intensity exercise cumulatively over 23 hours during and following the exercise. Secondary goals are to evaluate exercise difficulty during moderate intensity exercise and high interval exercise as well as difficulty of activities of daily living and free living physical activity following rest, moderate intensity exercise and high interval exercise.
A secondary study is designed to evaluate potential mechanism. Hypotheses are that changes in muscle lipid metabolism, mitochondrial function, fat and cellular insulin signals will be increased following the high intensity interval exercise. In addition, these changes will be related to changes in insulin sensitivity and increases in protein metabolism and muscle damage.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.description: To test the hypothesis that high interval exercise increases energy expenditure and Insulin sensitivity more than 2 days of rest or moderate intensity exercise cumulatively over 23 hours during and following the exercise

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate exercise difficulty during moderate intensity exercise and high interval exercise as well as difficulty of activities of daily living and free living physical activity following rest, moderate intensity exercise and high interval exercise

clinical_study.condition: Healthy Women Between the Ages of 21 - 40.

arm_group.description: Both groups will complete a VO2 maximum test, are provided food 2 days prior to assessments, exercise in the metabolic chamber, have a Resting Energy Expenditure test, complete a DEXA and have blood drawn. Both groups will remain, overnight in the metabolic chamber and have the clamp procedure. Exercise training is exactly the same for both groups. Those who select the muscle biopsies will complete this test a week following the metabolic room calorimeter visit. Those who select the Non-Biopsy group, in lieu of the biopsy test, will complete an Activities of Daily Living (ADL) test that involves sub-maximal VO2 assessment. The participants will also be asked to where an accelerometer home for 4 consecutive days after the ADL test.

intervention.description: Exercise training will consist of bicycle ergometer riding starting at 67% of heart rate max for 20 minutes. Exercise Intensity will be progressively increased every week until 80% of heart rate max for 40 minute sessions is reached.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy premenopausal African-American or Caucasian women ages 21-40
Exclusion Criteria:
- subjects cannot be smoking,
- taking medications which alter energy expenditure or fuel utilization,
- be diabetic or have a body mass index (BMI) less than 18 or more than 35.
- Also subjects cannot be pregnant or have cardiopulmonary disease.
